item.title: Trump Tax Bill to Boost Biden’s Semiconductor Tax Credit to 30%
item.description: The Senate’s draft tax bill calls for temporarily increasing an investment credit for semiconductor manufacturers, enhancing a subsidy for chipmakers to build factories in the US.
item.dc:creator: Alicia Diaz

media:content.media:description: A bare wafer stacker sorts silicon wafers in Building 51 at Micron Technology Inc. headquarters in Boise, Idaho, US, on Monday, June 10, 2024. The US announced in April its plans to award Micron Technology Inc. $6.1 billion in grants and as much as $7.5 billion in loans to help the memory-chip maker build new American factories, rounding out a slew of major federal awards for advanced semiconductor manufacturing.

item.title: SoftBank Seeks to Raise $4.9 Billion in T-Mobile Share Sale
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. is seeking to raise as much as $4.9 billion in an unregistered overnight block sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A T-Mobile store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. T-Mobile US Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23.

item.title: Washington Post Probes Hack of Journalist Email Accounts
item.description: The Washington Post is investigating a cyberattack on the email accounts of some journalists, prompting the newspaper to beef up its online security.
item.dc:creator: Mark Anderson, Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: The Washington Post office in Washington, DC. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump To Launch Mobile Services, New Training for Robots | Bloomberg Tech 6/16/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the Trump family’s plan for a self-branded mobile phone service. Plus, Meta launches ads on the privacy-focused messaging service WhatsApp. And robotics firm 1X Technologies announces a new “World Model” to train robots on the physical world using data-driven simulations. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Warner Bros. Wins Support From Bondholders for Debt Overhaul
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. said it won enough support from creditors to overhaul its debt as part of a plan to split into two separate companies, a significant victory for the entertainment giant as it tries to turn itself around.
item.dc:creator: Scott Carpenter

media:content.media:description: NEW YORK, NEW YORK - MAY 14: (L-R) Ryan Gould, U.S. Ad Sales President, Warner Bros. Discovery and Robert Voltaggio, U.S. Ad Sales President, Warner Bros. Discovery speak onstage during Warner Bros. Discovery’s 2025 Upfront Presentation at The Theater at Madison Square Garden on May 14, 2025 in New York City. (Photo by Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images for Warner Bros. Discovery)

item.title: Scale AI’s Wang Brings to Meta Knowledge of What Everyone Else is Doing
item.description: Scale AI co-founder Alexandr Wang is such an enthusiastic networker that his former roommate — OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman — once jokingly told him to tone it down a bit.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Huet

media:content.media:description: Alexandr Wang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Scale AI Inc., stands for a photograph after a Bloomberg Technology television interview in San Francisco, California, U.S., on Thursday, Aug. 8, 2019. Wang spoke about how Scale AI is using artificial intelligence to improve the safety of self-driving cars.

item.title: SFR Working to Restore Wireless Service Across France With Fix
item.description: Phone carrier SFR said it’s working on restoring mobile service after an issue caused a widespread mobile network outage across France.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot

media:content.media:description: An SFR mobile phone and telecom store, operated by Altice France SA in Paris, France, on Tuesday, Aug. 8, 2023. French-Israeli tycoon Patrick Drahi said he sees “no impact whatsoever” on Altice group from a corruption investigation in Portugal focused on key figures connected to his telecommunications empire. Photographer: Benjamin Girette/Bloomberg

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Review: Bigger and Mostly Better
item.description: The second-generation Switch brings design improvements and faster performance, but the battery life and game selection underwhelm.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: BC Partners-Backed Telco United Group Names KPN Alum as CEO
item.description: United Group, the southeastern European telecom operator owned by BC Partners, appointed former Royal KPN NV executive Stan Miller as chief executive officer.
item.dc:creator: Dinesh Nair

media:content.media:description: Fiber optic cables, center, and copper Ethernet cables feed into switches inside a communications room at an office in London, U.K., on Monday, May 21, 2018. The Department of Culture, Media and Sport will work with the Home Office to publish a white paper later this year setting out legislation, according to a statement, which will also seek to force tech giants to reveal how they target abusive and illegal online material posted by users. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Family Launches Branded Mobile Phone Service in US
item.description: President Donald Trump’s family is getting into the mobile phone business with a Trump-branded service that will rely on pre-existing wireless networks and hardware that is “made in America.”
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis, Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: Eric Trump, from left, Don Hendrickson, Eric Thomas, Patrick O’Brien, and Donald Trump Jr. during an announcement for Trump Mobile in New York on June 16.

item.title: CoreWeave Downgraded But Gets Street-High Price Target at Bank of America
item.description: CoreWeave Inc. was downgraded at Bank of America, with the firm citing valuation after shares of the cloud-computing provider quadrupled in recent months.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave signage in Times Square in New York.

item.title: Entain Jumps Most Since 2021 on BetMGM Guidance Upgrade
item.description: Entain Plc shares jumped the most in more than three-and-a-half years after the sports betting and gaming group upgraded its full-year revenue guidance for BetMGM, the US-based joint venture it shares with MGM Resorts International.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Solon

media:content.media:description: OXON HILL, MARYLAND - DECEMBER 09: MGM National Harbor, Governor Larry Hogan and Joe Theismann launch sports betting in Maryland with BETMGM at MGM National Harbor on December 09, 2021 in Oxon Hill, Maryland. (Photo by Shannon Finney/Getty Images for MGM National Harbor)

item.title: Air Taxi Firm Archer Sees More Defense Demand in Near Term
item.description: Electric aircraft maker Archer Aviation Inc. expects its defense-related sales outstripping commercial air taxis in the short term.
item.dc:creator: Leen Al-Rashdan, Guy Johnson, Kate Duffy

media:content.media:description: Adam Goldstein at the Paris Air Show in Paris on June 16.

item.title: Unicorn Juniper Square Sells Picks and Shovels of Private Market Boom
item.description: The financial technology startup has raised $130 million offering software to private investors.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

item.title: Samsung Is Building a Hub for Patients to Share Data with Doctors
item.dc:creator: Samantha Kelly

media:content.media:description: An attendee inspects a Galaxy Watch Ultra smartwatch at the Samsung Electronics Co. Unpacked launch in Paris.

item.title: WhatsApp to Show Ads, Offer Paid Subscriptions for First Time
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. will begin showing ads inside of its WhatsApp messaging service, opening a new potential revenue stream while the company invests heavily in artificial intelligence and other long-term projects.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: The Facebook Inc. WhatsApp application on a smartphone arranged in the Brooklyn Borough of New York, U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 5, 2021. Signal and Telegram, two private messenger apps, saw downloads and user sign-ups soar during the extended downtime of Facebook Inc.’s network of apps and services. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Israel’s Air Shield Is Tested Like Never Before as Iran Fires Ballistic Missiles
item.description: As Iran fires masses of ballistic missiles, Israel’s vaunted air defenses are being tested like never before.
item.dc:creator: Paul Wallace, Galit Altstein

item.title: Picton Plans More AI, Technology Hiring in Canadian Firm’s Growth Push
item.description: Canadian hedge fund manager David Picton says artificial intelligence will be a disruptive force for the money management industry, and his firm is looking to expand its technology capabilities as part of its growth plan.
item.dc:creator: Derek Decloet

media:content.media:description: David Picton

item.title: Roku Shares Jump on Amazon-Connected TV Advertising Partnership
item.description: Roku Inc. shares gain 11% premarket after the company and Amazon.com Inc.’s Amazon Ads announced a partnership, saying that advertisers will now have access to more than 80% of US households with connected TV though the Amazon DSP marketing tool.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

media:content.media:description: Roku, Inc. signage on an office building at 5 Times Square in New York, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 24, 2024. Streaming demand has led to a shift in ad budgets from the $55 billion linear-TV market to connected TV, where Roku leads with advanced ad-measurement tools, 86 million households and its Roku Channel platform.

item.title: Humanoid Robot Development Seen as Vital to the Future of Manufacturing
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow reports on the development of humanoid robots and their importance to the future of manufacturing.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Peggy Johnson, chief executive officer of Agility Robotics Inc., right, during a demonstration with a Digit humanoid robot during the Bloomberg Tech conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. The event brings together leaders across tech and business to discuss how executives, entrepreneurs and investors can navigate the hazards and multiply the opportunities in todays landscape.

item.title: How a Tiny Middleman Could Access Two-Factor Login Codes From Tech Giants
item.description: An investigation into the complexity of the global telecom system shows weaknesses in the transmission of secret codes sent via SMS.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gallagher, Crofton Black, Gabriel Geiger

item.title: Imax Adds China Screens With Wanda, Betting on Blockbusters
item.description: Imax Corp.’s Chinese arm is aggressively adding screens across the country, betting on big local and US productions to boost its sales in the world’s second-largest film market.
item.dc:creator: Sohee Kim

media:content.media:description: Moviegoers watch Ne Zha 2 at an IMAX GT Cinema in Guiyang, China, in February. Photographer: Qu Honglun/China News Service/VCG/Getty Images

item.title: Apple Risks Fresh EU Charge Sheet Over App Store Curbs
item.description: Apple Inc. is edging toward another charge sheet from European Union antitrust watchdogs unless it quickly fixes alleged violations of a new digital law that led to a €500 million ($579 million) fine earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a smartphone Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Bitcoin Buyer Metaplanet Is Now Bigger Than Chipmaker Kioxia
item.description: Japan’s hotelier-turned-Bitcoin-buyer Metaplanet Inc. overtook memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. in terms of market capitalization as the stock soared nearly 400% in less than two months, riding the global crypto rally.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

item.title: TikTok Pushes Deeper Into AI-Generated Video Ads With New Tools
item.description: TikTok is rolling out a set of new artificial intelligence-powered advertising features, including the ability for marketers to use text or still images to create AI-generated video for the service.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: TikTok displayed on a smartphone with TikTok Icon seen in the background, in this photo illustration. On 18 September 2023, in Brussels, Belgium. (Photo illustration by Jonathan Raa/NurPhoto via AP) Photographer: Jonathan Raa/NURPHO

item.title: China Joins US in Brain Implant Race With Clinical Trial
item.description: China’s first clinical trial of a technology that allows signals from the brain to control an external device has proved successful, making it only the second country after the US to reach this stage, according to the Global Times.
item.dc:creator: Karoline Kan

item.title: Taiwan Imposes Technology Export Controls on Huawei, SMIC
item.description: Taiwan has blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co. and Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp., dealing another major blow to the two companies spearheading China’s efforts to develop cutting-edge AI chip technologies.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: Components of a Huawei Technologies Co. Mate X5 smartphone, including a Kirin 9000s chip fabricated in China by Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. (SMIC), arranged in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, on Tuesday, Sept. 19, 2023. Huawei's Kirin 9000s processor supports 5G wireless speeds, TechInsights said, dispelling some of the mystery around the Chinese company's latest devices.

item.title: Apple’s Upgrades to CarPlay, iPad and Vision Pro Outshine Liquid Glass
item.description: Apple’s unveiling of iOS 26 and the Liquid Glass interface was the most discussed part of its developers conference, but the real gems were its enhancements to CarPlay, the Vision Pro and the iPad. Also: Delayed Siri upgrades are now targeted for next spring; Apple’s AI chief lies low at WWDC; and the company gets cozier with OpenAI.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Attendees watch the keynote address during the Apple Worldwide Developers Conference in Cupertino, California.

item.title: BT CEO Says AI Advances Could Deepen Job Cuts: FT
item.description: BT Group Plc CEO Allison Kirkby says that advancements in artificial intelligence could deepen the job cuts that are already happening at the telecommunications firm in an interview with the Financial Times.
item.dc:creator: Yi Wei Wong

media:content.media:description: Allison Kirkby, chief executive officer of Telia AB, speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview on the opening day of the MWC Barcelona at the Fira de Barcelona venue in Barcelona, Spain, on Monday, Feb. 28, 2022. Over 1,800 exhibitors and attendees from 183 countries will attend the annual event, which runs from Feb. 28 to March 3.

item.title: China’s Biotech Moment Ignites a 60% Stock Rally That Beats AI
item.description: China’s biotechnology stocks have shaken off a four-year slump to be among the hottest performers in Asia this year and funds are tipping further gains.
item.dc:creator: Sangmi Cha, Winnie Hsu, Amber Tong
